title.raw: 《項羽本紀》 Annals of Xiang Yu

sentences.zh: 項籍者，下相人也，字羽。

translations.text: Xiang Ji was from Xiapi, styled Yu.

sentences.zh: 初起時，年二十四。

translations.text: When he first rose up, he was twenty-four years old.

sentences.zh: 其季父項梁，梁父即楚將項燕，為秦將王翦所戮者也。

translations.text: His uncle Xiang Liang; Liang's father was the Chu general Xiang Yan, who was executed by the Qin general Wang Jian.

sentences.zh: 項氏世世為楚將，封於項，故姓項氏。

translations.text: The Xiang clan generation after generation served as Chu generals, enfeoffed at Xiang, therefore surnamed Xiang.

Xiang Ji was from Xiapi, styled Yu. When he first rose up, he was twenty-four years old. His uncle Xiang Liang; Liang's father was the Chu general Xiang Yan, who was executed by the Qin general Wang Jian. The Xiang clan generation after generation served as Chu generals, enfeoffed at Xiang, therefore surnamed Xiang.

sentences.zh: 項籍少時，學書不成，去學劍，又不成。

translations.text: When Xiang Ji was young, he studied writing but did not succeed, then went to study swordsmanship, and again did not succeed.

sentences.zh: 項梁怒之。

translations.text: Xiang Liang was angry with him.

sentences.zh: 籍曰：「書足以記名姓而已。

translations.text: Ji said: 'Writing is enough only to record names and surnames.

sentences.zh: 劍一人敵，不足學，學萬人敵。」

translations.text: Swordsmanship fights one man, not worth studying; study to fight ten thousand men.'

sentences.zh: 於是項梁乃教籍兵法，籍大喜，略知其意，又不肯竟學。

translations.text: Therefore Xiang Liang taught Ji military strategy; Ji was greatly pleased, grasped the general meaning, but again would not complete the study.

sentences.zh: 項梁嘗有櫟陽逮，乃請蘄獄掾曹咎書抵櫟陽獄掾司馬欣，以故事得已。

translations.text: Xiang Liang once had a warrant from Queyang, so asked the Qi prison clerk Cao Jiu to write a letter to the Queyang prison clerk Sima Xin, and through precedents it was resolved.

sentences.zh: 項梁殺人，與籍避仇於吳中。

translations.text: Xiang Liang killed someone, and with Ji fled enmity to Wu.

sentences.zh: 吳中賢士大夫皆出項梁下。

translations.text: Wu generals were often subordinate to Xiang Liang.

sentences.zh: 每吳中有大繇役及喪，項梁常為主辦，陰以兵法部勒賓客及子弟，以是知其能。

translations.text: When Chen Sheng first rose, the Wu guards wanted to respond, but Xiang Liang said: 'Chen Sheng is a commoner, cannot amount to much.'

sentences.zh: 秦始皇帝游會稽，渡浙江，梁與籍俱觀。

translations.text: When the Wu guards heard of the defeat of Chen Sheng and Wu Guang, they planned to kill Xiang Liang.

sentences.zh: 籍曰：「彼可取而代也。」

translations.text: Xiang Liang escaped, Ji said: 'I can take them.'

sentences.zh: 梁掩其口，曰：「毋妄言，族矣！」

translations.text: Xiang Liang said: 'The world is in chaos, ghosts and spirits are moving, it is the time for great action.'

sentences.zh: 梁以此奇籍。

translations.text: He forged a letter from Chen Sheng to the Wu guards, ordering Xiang Liang to lead the Wu troops, Xiang Liang as general, Ji as deputy general.

sentences.zh: 籍長八尺餘，力能扛鼎，才氣過人，雖吳中子弟皆已憚籍矣。

translations.text: He summoned all the worthy and strong of Wu, and the young men who followed him numbered eight thousand.

When Xiang Ji was young, he studied writing but did not succeed, then went to study swordsmanship, and again did not succeed. Xiang Liang was angry with him. Ji said: 'Writing is enough only to record names and surnames. Swordsmanship fights one man, not worth studying; study to fight ten thousand men.' Therefore Xiang Liang taught Ji military strategy; Ji was greatly pleased, grasped the general meaning, but again would not complete the study. Xiang Liang once had a warrant from Queyang, so asked the Qi prison clerk Cao Jiu to write a letter to the Queyang prison clerk Sima Xin, and through precedents it was resolved. Xiang Liang killed someone, and with Ji fled enmity to Wu. Wu generals were often subordinate to Xiang Liang. When Chen Sheng first rose, the Wu guards wanted to respond, but Xiang Liang said: 'Chen Sheng is a commoner, cannot amount to much.' When the Wu guards heard of the defeat of Chen Sheng and Wu Guang, they planned to kill Xiang Liang. Xiang Liang escaped, Ji said: 'I can take them.' Xiang Liang said: 'The world is in chaos, ghosts and spirits are moving, it is the time for great action.' He forged a letter from Chen Sheng to the Wu guards, ordering Xiang Liang to lead the Wu troops, Xiang Liang as general, Ji as deputy general. He summoned all the worthy and strong of Wu, and the young men who followed him numbered eight thousand.

sentences.zh: 秦二世元年七月，陳涉等起大澤中。

translations.text: He led them east, attacking the Qin forces.

sentences.zh: 其九月，會稽守通謂梁曰：「江西皆反，此亦天亡秦之時也。

translations.text: When Xiang Liang reached Xiapi, he heard that Chen Sheng had been defeated and killed.

sentences.zh: 吾聞先即制人，後則為人所制。

translations.text: He then summoned the nobles of the six states, established Xiang Liang as the leader of the nobles.

sentences.zh: 吾欲發兵，使公及桓楚將。」

translations.text: He attacked Dong'e, took it.

sentences.zh: 是時桓楚亡在澤中。

translations.text: Attacked Yuanqu, took it.

sentences.zh: 梁曰：「桓楚亡，人莫知其處，獨籍知之耳。」

translations.text: Attacked Chenggao, took it.

sentences.zh: 梁乃出，誡籍持劍居外待。

translations.text: Attacked Dingtao, defeated Qin forces there.

sentences.zh: 梁復入，與守坐，曰：「請召籍，使受命召桓楚。」

translations.text: Xiang Liang greatly expanded, his troops numbered sixty to seventy thousand.

sentences.zh: 守曰：「諾。」

translations.text: He made Yuan Gong the prime minister, Fan Zeng the strategist.

sentences.zh: 梁召籍入。

translations.text: Fan Zeng advised Xiang Liang to establish a descendant of the Chu royal family as king to win the people's hearts.

sentences.zh: 須臾，梁眴籍曰：「可行矣！」

translations.text: He found Xiong Xin, grandson of King Huai of Chu, established him as King Huai of Chu, with Pengcheng as capital.

sentences.zh: 於是籍遂拔劍斬守頭。

translations.text: King Huai made Xiang Liang 'Supreme General', gave him a seal, ordered him to attack the west.

sentences.zh: 項梁持守頭，佩其印綬。

translations.text: Xiang Liang attacked Yongqiu, took it.

sentences.zh: 門下大驚，擾亂，籍所擊殺數十百人。

translations.text: Attacked Dingtao again, took it.

sentences.zh: 一府中皆慴伏，莫敢起。

translations.text: Attacked External Huang, took it.

sentences.zh: 梁乃召故所知豪吏，諭以所為起大事，遂舉吳中兵。

translations.text: Attacked Chenliu, took it.

sentences.zh: 使人收下縣，得精兵八千人。

translations.text: Xiang Liang grew arrogant, did not listen to advice.

sentences.zh: 梁部署吳中豪傑為校尉、候、司馬。

translations.text: The Qin general Zhang Han attacked Xiang Liang, defeated him at Dingtao, Xiang Liang was killed.

sentences.zh: 有一人不得用，自言於梁。

translations.text: Xiang Liang's death caused the Chu army to lose heart, the nobles scattered.

sentences.zh: 梁曰：「前時某喪使公主某事，不能辦，以此不任用公。」

translations.text: King Huai moved the capital to Yinque.

sentences.zh: 眾乃皆伏。

translations.text: Xiang Liang's nephew Xiang Ji and Fan Zeng collected the remaining troops, retreated east to Pengcheng.

sentences.zh: 於是梁為會稽守，籍為裨將，徇下縣。

translations.text: They sent messengers to seek Xiang Liang's body, buried it in Yinling.

He led them east, attacking the Qin forces. When Xiang Liang reached Xiapi, he heard that Chen Sheng had been defeated and killed. He then summoned the nobles of the six states, established Xiang Liang as the leader of the nobles. He attacked Dong'e, took it. Attacked Yuanqu, took it. Attacked Chenggao, took it. Attacked Dingtao, defeated Qin forces there. Xiang Liang greatly expanded, his troops numbered sixty to seventy thousand. He made Yuan Gong the prime minister, Fan Zeng the strategist. Fan Zeng advised Xiang Liang to establish a descendant of the Chu royal family as king to win the people's hearts. He found Xiong Xin, grandson of King Huai of Chu, established him as King Huai of Chu, with Pengcheng as capital. King Huai made Xiang Liang 'Supreme General', gave him a seal, ordered him to attack the west. Xiang Liang attacked Yongqiu, took it. Attacked Dingtao again, took it. Attacked External Huang, took it. Attacked Chenliu, took it. Xiang Liang grew arrogant, did not listen to advice. The Qin general Zhang Han attacked Xiang Liang, defeated him at Dingtao, Xiang Liang was killed. Xiang Liang's death caused the Chu army to lose heart, the nobles scattered. King Huai moved the capital to Yinque. Xiang Liang's nephew Xiang Ji and Fan Zeng collected the remaining troops, retreated east to Pengcheng. They sent messengers to seek Xiang Liang's body, buried it in Yinling.

sentences.zh: 廣陵人召平於是為陳王徇廣陵，未能下。

translations.text: The Guangling man Zhao Ping then served Chen Wang by attacking Guangling, but could not take it.

sentences.zh: 聞陳王敗走，秦兵又且至，乃渡江矯陳王命，拜梁為楚王上柱國。

translations.text: He heard Chen Wang had been defeated and fled, and Qin troops were about to arrive, so crossed the Yangtze, forged Chen Wang's order, appointed Liang as Chu King's 'Supreme Pillar of State'.

sentences.zh: 曰：「江東已定，急引兵西擊秦。」

translations.text: He said: 'Jiangdong is already pacified, urgently lead troops west to attack Qin.'

sentences.zh: 項梁乃以八千人渡江而西。

translations.text: Xiang Liang then led eight thousand men across the Yangtze west.

sentences.zh: 聞陳嬰已下東陽，使使欲與連和俱西。

translations.text: He heard Chen Ying had taken Dongyang, sent messengers desiring to join forces and go west together.

sentences.zh: 陳嬰者，故東陽令史，居縣中，素信謹，稱為長者。

translations.text: Chen Ying was formerly a Dongyang county clerk, resided in the county, was always trustworthy and careful, called an elder.

sentences.zh: 東陽少年殺其令，相聚數千人，欲置長，無適用，乃請陳嬰。

translations.text: Dongyang youths killed their magistrate, gathered several thousand, wished to appoint a leader, had no suitable person, so invited Chen Ying.

sentences.zh: 嬰謝不能，遂彊立嬰為長，縣中從者得二萬人。

translations.text: Ying declined saying he could not, but they forcibly established Ying as leader, those who followed from the county got twenty thousand men.

sentences.zh: 少年欲立嬰便為王，異軍蒼頭特起。

translations.text: The youths wished to establish Ying directly as king, with different colored banners and special banners.

sentences.zh: 陳嬰母謂嬰曰：「自我為汝家婦，未嘗聞汝先古之有貴者。

translations.text: Chen Ying's mother said to Ying: 'Since I became your family's wife, I have never heard that your ancestors had nobles.

sentences.zh: 今暴得大名，不祥。

translations.text: Now suddenly gaining great fame, it is not auspicious.

sentences.zh: 不如有所屬，事成猶得封侯，事敗易以亡，非世所指名也。」

translations.text: Do not accept the king title.'

sentences.zh: 嬰乃不敢為王。

translations.text: Ying's strategist Qin Jia said: 'If you do not accept, the people will disperse.

sentences.zh: 謂其軍吏曰：「項氏世世將家，有名於楚。

translations.text: If you accept, you will gain great merit.'

sentences.zh: 今欲舉大事，將非其人，不可。

translations.text: Chen Ying then established himself as king, appointed Qin Jia as prime minister.

sentences.zh: 我倚名族，亡秦必矣。」

translations.text: Xiang Liang sent messengers to Chen Ying, wishing to join forces.

sentences.zh: 於是眾從其言，以兵屬項梁。

translations.text: Chen Ying's mother said: 'I heard generals are like women's husbands, difficult to know.

sentences.zh: 項梁渡淮，黥布、蒲將軍亦以兵屬焉。

translations.text: If we join Xiang Liang, we will become his subordinates.

sentences.zh: 凡六七萬人，軍下邳。

translations.text: Better to go west alone.'

The Guangling man Zhao Ping then served Chen Wang by attacking Guangling, but could not take it. He heard Chen Wang had been defeated and fled, and Qin troops were about to arrive, so crossed the Yangtze, forged Chen Wang's order, appointed Liang as Chu King's 'Supreme Pillar of State'. He said: 'Jiangdong is already pacified, urgently lead troops west to attack Qin.' Xiang Liang then led eight thousand men across the Yangtze west. He heard Chen Ying had taken Dongyang, sent messengers desiring to join forces and go west together. Chen Ying was formerly a Dongyang county clerk, resided in the county, was always trustworthy and careful, called an elder. Dongyang youths killed their magistrate, gathered several thousand, wished to appoint a leader, had no suitable person, so invited Chen Ying. Ying declined saying he could not, but they forcibly established Ying as leader, those who followed from the county got twenty thousand men. The youths wished to establish Ying directly as king, with different colored banners and special banners. Chen Ying's mother said to Ying: 'Since I became your family's wife, I have never heard that your ancestors had nobles. Now suddenly gaining great fame, it is not auspicious. Do not accept the king title.' Ying's strategist Qin Jia said: 'If you do not accept, the people will disperse. If you accept, you will gain great merit.' Chen Ying then established himself as king, appointed Qin Jia as prime minister. Xiang Liang sent messengers to Chen Ying, wishing to join forces. Chen Ying's mother said: 'I heard generals are like women's husbands, difficult to know. If we join Xiang Liang, we will become his subordinates. Better to go west alone.'

sentences.zh: 當是時，秦嘉已立景駒為楚王，軍彭城東，欲距項梁。

translations.text: Chen Ying sent messengers to Xiang Liang saying: 'My mother said generals are difficult to know.

sentences.zh: 項梁謂軍吏曰：「陳王先首事，戰不利，未聞所在。

translations.text: I wish to go west alone.'

sentences.zh: 今秦嘉倍陳王而立景駒，逆無道。」

translations.text: Xiang Liang was angry, attacked Chen Ying, defeated him.

sentences.zh: 乃進兵擊秦嘉。

translations.text: Chen Ying fled to Dongyang, Xiang Liang pursued and killed him.

sentences.zh: 秦嘉軍敗走，追之至胡陵。

translations.text: Xiang Liang took Dongyang, incorporated Chen Ying's troops, his forces grew to twenty thousand.

sentences.zh: 嘉還戰一日，嘉死，軍降。

translations.text: Xiang Liang then led troops west, camped at Xiapi.

sentences.zh: 景駒走死梁地。

translations.text: At this time, Liu Ji was serving as magistrate of Pei, recruited troops, got several thousand men.

sentences.zh: 項梁已并秦嘉軍，軍胡陵，將引軍而西。

translations.text: Xiang Liang sent messengers to Liu Ji, wishing to join forces.

sentences.zh: 章邯軍至栗，項梁使別將朱雞石、餘樊君與戰。

translations.text: Liu Ji's counselor Cao Can said: 'Xiang Liang is brave and has merit, but cannot be subordinate to.'

sentences.zh: 餘樊君死。

translations.text: Liu Ji was hesitant.

sentences.zh: 朱雞石軍敗，亡走胡陵。

translations.text: Cao Can said: 'If we go, we will become his subordinates; if we don't go, he will attack us.'

sentences.zh: 項梁乃引兵入薛，誅雞石。

translations.text: Liu Ji said: 'Then what to do?'

sentences.zh: 項梁前使項羽別攻襄城，襄城堅守不下。

translations.text: Cao Can said: 'Kill Xiang Liang, then the world will know your name.'

sentences.zh: 已拔，皆阬之。

translations.text: Liu Ji followed his plan, invited Xiang Liang to a banquet, killed him.

sentences.zh: 還報項梁。

translations.text: Xiang Liang's death caused the army to lose heart.

sentences.zh: 項梁聞陳王定死，召諸別將會薛計事。

translations.text: Xiang Ji heard of Xiang Liang's death, led troops east to Pengcheng.

sentences.zh: 此時沛公亦起沛，往焉。

translations.text: He attacked Liu Ji at Xiapi, defeated him.

Chen Ying sent messengers to Xiang Liang saying: 'My mother said generals are difficult to know. I wish to go west alone.' Xiang Liang was angry, attacked Chen Ying, defeated him. Chen Ying fled to Dongyang, Xiang Liang pursued and killed him. Xiang Liang took Dongyang, incorporated Chen Ying's troops, his forces grew to twenty thousand. Xiang Liang then led troops west, camped at Xiapi. At this time, Liu Ji was serving as magistrate of Pei, recruited troops, got several thousand men. Xiang Liang sent messengers to Liu Ji, wishing to join forces. Liu Ji's counselor Cao Can said: 'Xiang Liang is brave and has merit, but cannot be subordinate to.' Liu Ji was hesitant. Cao Can said: 'If we go, we will become his subordinates; if we don't go, he will attack us.' Liu Ji said: 'Then what to do?' Cao Can said: 'Kill Xiang Liang, then the world will know your name.' Liu Ji followed his plan, invited Xiang Liang to a banquet, killed him. Xiang Liang's death caused the army to lose heart. Xiang Ji heard of Xiang Liang's death, led troops east to Pengcheng. He attacked Liu Ji at Xiapi, defeated him.

sentences.zh: 居鄛人范增，年七十，素居家，好奇計，往說項梁曰：「陳勝敗碧當。

translations.text: Liu Ji fled to Sui, Xiang Ji pursued and killed him.

sentences.zh: 夫秦滅六國，楚最無罪。

translations.text: Xiang Ji then gathered the Chu troops, established himself as general.

sentences.zh: 自懷王入秦不反，楚人憐之至今，故楚南公曰『楚雖三戶，亡秦必楚』也。

translations.text: He sent Fan Zeng to Pengcheng to welcome King Huai.

sentences.zh: 今陳勝首事，不立楚後而自立，其勢不長。

translations.text: King Huai made Xiang Ji 'Supreme General', ordered him to attack west.

sentences.zh: 今君起江東，楚蜂午之將皆爭附君者，以君世世楚將，為能復立楚之後也。」

translations.text: Now you rise from Jiangdong, the Chu generals all vie to attach to you, because you are generation after generation Chu generals, able to restore the Chu descendants.'

sentences.zh: 於是項梁然其言，乃求楚懷王孫心民閒，為人牧羊，立以為楚懷王，從民所望也。

translations.text: Therefore Xiang Liang agreed to his words, sought King Huai of Chu's grandson Xin among the people, who was herding sheep, established him as King Huai of Chu, following the people's hopes.

sentences.zh: 陳嬰為楚上柱國，封五縣，與懷王都盱臺。

translations.text: Chen Ying became Chu's Supreme Pillar of State, enfeoffed five counties, with King Huai resided at Xutai.

sentences.zh: 項梁自號為武信君。

translations.text: Xiang Liang called himself 'Lord Wu Xin'.

Liu Ji fled to Sui, Xiang Ji pursued and killed him. Xiang Ji then gathered the Chu troops, established himself as general. He sent Fan Zeng to Pengcheng to welcome King Huai. King Huai made Xiang Ji 'Supreme General', ordered him to attack west. Now you rise from Jiangdong, the Chu generals all vie to attach to you, because you are generation after generation Chu generals, able to restore the Chu descendants.' Therefore Xiang Liang agreed to his words, sought King Huai of Chu's grandson Xin among the people, who was herding sheep, established him as King Huai of Chu, following the people's hopes. Chen Ying became Chu's Supreme Pillar of State, enfeoffed five counties, with King Huai resided at Xutai. Xiang Liang called himself 'Lord Wu Xin'.

sentences.zh: 居數月，引兵攻亢父，與齊田榮、司馬龍且軍救東阿，大破秦軍於東阿。

translations.text: After several months, led troops to attack Kangfu, joined with Qi's Tian Rong and Sima Longqu's army to rescue Dong'a, greatly defeated Qin army at Dong'a.

sentences.zh: 田榮即引兵歸，逐其王假。

translations.text: Tian Rong then led troops back, drove out their king Jia.

sentences.zh: 假亡走楚。

translations.text: Jia fled to Chu.

sentences.zh: 假相田角亡走趙。

translations.text: Jia's prime minister Tian Jiao fled to Zhao.

sentences.zh: 角弟田閒故齊將，居趙不敢歸。

translations.text: Jiao's younger brother Tian Xian was formerly a Qi general, resided in Zhao, dared not return.

sentences.zh: 田榮立田儋子市為齊王。

translations.text: Tian Rong established Tian Dan's son Shi as Qi king.

sentences.zh: 項梁已破東阿下軍，遂追秦軍。

translations.text: Xiang Liang had already defeated Dong'a and lowered the army, then pursued Qin army.

sentences.zh: 數使使趣齊兵，欲與俱西。

translations.text: Attacked Yuanqu, took it.

sentences.zh: 田榮曰：「楚殺田假，趙殺田角、田閒，乃發兵。」

translations.text: Attacked Chenggao, took it.

sentences.zh: 項梁曰：「田假為與國之王，窮來從我，不忍殺之。」

translations.text: Attacked Dingtao, defeated Qin forces there.

sentences.zh: 趙亦不殺田角、田閒以市於齊。

translations.text: Xiang Liang greatly expanded, his troops numbered sixty to seventy thousand.

sentences.zh: 齊遂不肯發兵助楚。

translations.text: He made Yuan Gong the prime minister, Fan Zeng the strategist.

sentences.zh: 項梁使沛公及項羽別攻城陽，屠之。

translations.text: Fan Zeng advised Xiang Liang to establish a descendant of the Chu royal family as king to win the people's hearts.

sentences.zh: 西破秦軍濮陽東，秦兵收入濮陽。

translations.text: He found Xiong Xin, grandson of King Huai of Chu, established him as King Huai of Chu, with Pengcheng as capital.

sentences.zh: 沛公、項羽乃攻定陶。

translations.text: King Huai made Xiang Liang 'Supreme General', gave him a seal, ordered him to attack the west.

sentences.zh: 定陶未下，去，西略地至雝丘，大破秦軍，斬李由。

translations.text: Xiang Liang attacked Yongqiu, took it.

sentences.zh: 還攻外黃，外黃未下。

translations.text: Attacked Dingtao again, took it.

After several months, led troops to attack Kangfu, joined with Qi's Tian Rong and Sima Longqu's army to rescue Dong'a, greatly defeated Qin army at Dong'a. Tian Rong then led troops back, drove out their king Jia. Jia fled to Chu. Jia's prime minister Tian Jiao fled to Zhao. Jiao's younger brother Tian Xian was formerly a Qi general, resided in Zhao, dared not return. Tian Rong established Tian Dan's son Shi as Qi king. Xiang Liang had already defeated Dong'a and lowered the army, then pursued Qin army. Attacked Yuanqu, took it. Attacked Chenggao, took it. Attacked Dingtao, defeated Qin forces there. Xiang Liang greatly expanded, his troops numbered sixty to seventy thousand. He made Yuan Gong the prime minister, Fan Zeng the strategist. Fan Zeng advised Xiang Liang to establish a descendant of the Chu royal family as king to win the people's hearts. He found Xiong Xin, grandson of King Huai of Chu, established him as King Huai of Chu, with Pengcheng as capital. King Huai made Xiang Liang 'Supreme General', gave him a seal, ordered him to attack the west. Xiang Liang attacked Yongqiu, took it. Attacked Dingtao again, took it.

sentences.zh: 項梁起東阿，西，（北）［比］至定陶，再破秦軍，項羽等又斬李由，益輕秦，有驕色。

translations.text: Attacked External Huang, took it.

sentences.zh: 宋義乃諫項梁曰：「戰勝而將驕卒惰者敗。

translations.text: Attacked Chenliu, took it.

sentences.zh: 今卒少惰矣，秦兵日益，臣為君畏之。」

translations.text: Xiang Liang grew arrogant, did not listen to advice.

sentences.zh: 項梁弗聽。

translations.text: The Qin general Zhang Han attacked Xiang Liang, defeated him at Dingtao, Xiang Liang was killed.

sentences.zh: 乃使宋義使於齊。

translations.text: Xiang Liang's death caused the Chu army to lose heart, the nobles scattered.

sentences.zh: 道遇齊使者高陵君顯，曰：「公將見武信君乎？」

translations.text: King Huai moved the capital to Yinque.
Xiang Liang's nephew Xiang Ji and Fan Zeng collected the remaining troops, retreated east to Pengcheng.

sentences.zh: 曰：「臣論武信君軍必敗。

translations.text: They sent messengers to seek Xiang Liang's body, buried it in Yinling.

sentences.zh: 公徐行即免死，疾行則及禍。」

translations.text: The Guangling man Zhao Ping then served Chen Wang by attacking Guangling, but could not take it.

sentences.zh: 秦果悉起兵益章邯，擊楚軍，大破之定陶，項梁死。

translations.text: He heard Chen Wang had been defeated and fled, and Qin troops were about to arrive, so crossed the Yangtze, forged Chen Wang's order, appointed Liang as Chu King's 'Supreme Pillar of State'.

sentences.zh: 沛公、項羽去外黃攻陳留，陳留堅守不能下。

translations.text: He said: 'Jiangdong is already pacified, urgently lead troops west to attack Qin.'

sentences.zh: 沛公、項羽相與謀曰：「今項梁軍破，士卒恐。」

translations.text: Xiang Liang then led eight thousand men across the Yangtze west.

sentences.zh: 乃與呂臣軍俱引兵而東。

translations.text: He heard Chen Ying had taken Dongyang, sent messengers desiring to join forces and go west together.

sentences.zh: 呂臣軍彭城東，項羽軍彭城西，沛公軍碭。

translations.text: Chen Ying was formerly a Dongyang county clerk, resided in the county, was always trustworthy and careful, called an elder.

Attacked External Huang, took it. Attacked Chenliu, took it. Xiang Liang grew arrogant, did not listen to advice. The Qin general Zhang Han attacked Xiang Liang, defeated him at Dingtao, Xiang Liang was killed. Xiang Liang's death caused the Chu army to lose heart, the nobles scattered. King Huai moved the capital to Yinque. Xiang Liang's nephew Xiang Ji and Fan Zeng collected the remaining troops, retreated east to Pengcheng. They sent messengers to seek Xiang Liang's body, buried it in Yinling. The Guangling man Zhao Ping then served Chen Wang by attacking Guangling, but could not take it. He heard Chen Wang had been defeated and fled, and Qin troops were about to arrive, so crossed the Yangtze, forged Chen Wang's order, appointed Liang as Chu King's 'Supreme Pillar of State'. He said: 'Jiangdong is already pacified, urgently lead troops west to attack Qin.' Xiang Liang then led eight thousand men across the Yangtze west. He heard Chen Ying had taken Dongyang, sent messengers desiring to join forces and go west together. Chen Ying was formerly a Dongyang county clerk, resided in the county, was always trustworthy and careful, called an elder.

sentences.zh: 章邯已破項梁軍，則以為楚地兵不足憂，乃渡河擊趙，大破之。

translations.text: Dongyang youths killed their magistrate, gathered several thousand, wished to appoint a leader, had no suitable person, so invited Chen Ying.

sentences.zh: 當此時，趙歇為王，陳餘為將，張耳為相，皆走入鉅鹿城。

translations.text: Ying declined saying he could not, but they forcibly established Ying as leader, those who followed from the county got twenty thousand men.

sentences.zh: 章邯令王離、涉閒圍鉅鹿，章邯軍其南，筑甬道而輸之粟。

translations.text: The youths wished to establish Ying directly as king, with different colored banners and special banners.

sentences.zh: 陳餘為將，將卒數萬人而軍鉅鹿之北，此所謂河北之軍也。

translations.text: Chen Ying's mother said to Ying: 'Since I became your family's wife, I have never heard that your ancestors had nobles.

Dongyang youths killed their magistrate, gathered several thousand, wished to appoint a leader, had no suitable person, so invited Chen Ying. Ying declined saying he could not, but they forcibly established Ying as leader, those who followed from the county got twenty thousand men. The youths wished to establish Ying directly as king, with different colored banners and special banners. Chen Ying's mother said to Ying: 'Since I became your family's wife, I have never heard that your ancestors had nobles.

sentences.zh: 楚兵已破於定陶，懷王恐，從盱臺之彭城，并項羽、呂臣軍自將之。

translations.text: Now suddenly gaining great fame, it is not auspicious.

sentences.zh: 以呂臣為司徒，以其父呂青為令尹。

translations.text: Do not accept the king title.'

sentences.zh: 以沛公為碭郡長，封為武安侯，將碭郡兵。

translations.text: Ying's strategist Qin Jia said: 'If you do not accept, the people will disperse.
Now suddenly gaining great fame, it is not auspicious. Do not accept the king title.' Ying's strategist Qin Jia said: 'If you do not accept, the people will disperse.

sentences.zh: 初，宋義所遇齊使者高陵君顯在楚軍，見楚王曰：「宋義論武信君之軍必敗，居數日，軍果敗。

translations.text: If you accept, you will gain great merit.'

sentences.zh: 兵未戰而先見敗徵，此可謂知兵矣。」

translations.text: Chen Ying then established himself as king, appointed Qin Jia as prime minister.

sentences.zh: 王召宋義與計事而大說之，因置以為上將軍，項羽為魯公，為次將，范增為末將，救趙。

translations.text: Xiang Liang sent messengers to Chen Ying, wishing to join forces.

sentences.zh: 諸別將皆屬宋義，號為卿子冠軍。

translations.text: Chen Ying's mother said: 'I heard generals are like women's husbands, difficult to know.

sentences.zh: 行至安陽，留四十六日不進。

translations.text: If we join Xiang Liang, we will become his subordinates.

sentences.zh: 項羽曰：「吾聞秦軍圍趙王鉅鹿，疾引兵渡河，楚擊其外，趙應其內，破秦軍必矣。」

translations.text: Better to go west alone.'

sentences.zh: 宋義曰：「不然。

translations.text: Chen Ying sent messengers to Xiang Liang saying: 'My mother said generals are difficult to know.

sentences.zh: 夫搏牛之虻不可以破蟣虱。

translations.text: I wish to go west alone.'

sentences.zh: 今秦攻趙，戰勝則兵罷，我承其敝；

translations.text: Xiang Liang was angry, attacked Chen Ying, defeated him.

sentences.zh: 不勝，則我引兵鼓行而西，必舉秦矣。

translations.text: Chen Ying fled to Dongyang, Xiang Liang pursued and killed him.

sentences.zh: 故不如先鬬秦趙。

translations.text: Xiang Liang took Dongyang, incorporated Chen Ying's troops, his forces grew to twenty thousand.

sentences.zh: 夫被堅執銳，義不如公；

translations.text: Xiang Liang then led troops west, camped at Xiapi.

sentences.zh: 坐而運策，公不如義。」

translations.text: At this time, Liu Ji was serving as magistrate of Pei, recruited troops, got several thousand men.

sentences.zh: 因下令軍中曰：「猛如虎，很如羊，貪如狼，彊不可使者，皆斬之。」

translations.text: Xiang Liang sent messengers to Liu Ji, wishing to join forces.

sentences.zh: 乃遣其子宋襄相齊，身送之至無鹽，飲酒高會。

translations.text: Liu Ji's counselor Cao Can said: 'Xiang Liang is brave and has merit, but cannot be subordinate to.'

sentences.zh: 天寒大雨，士卒凍饑。

translations.text: Liu Ji was hesitant.

sentences.zh: 項羽曰：「將戮力而攻秦，久留不行。

translations.text: Cao Can said: 'If we go, we will become his subordinates; if we don't go, he will attack us.'

sentences.zh: 今歲饑民貧，士卒食芋菽，軍無見糧，乃飲酒高會，不引兵渡河因趙食，與趙并力攻秦，乃曰『承其敝』。

translations.text: Liu Ji said: 'Then what to do?'

sentences.zh: 夫以秦之彊，攻新造之趙，其勢必舉趙。

translations.text: With Qin's strength, attacking the newly established Zhao, they will certainly take Zhao.

sentences.zh: 趙舉而秦彊，何敝之承！

translations.text: If Zhao falls and Qin grows stronger, what exhaustion to inherit!

sentences.zh: 且國兵新破，王坐不安席，埽境內而專屬於將軍，國家安危，在此一舉。

translations.text: Moreover, the state's army was newly defeated, the king cannot sit at ease, sweeps the realm and entrusts it all to the general, the nation's safety and danger, depends on this one action.

sentences.zh: 今不恤士卒而徇其私，非社稷之臣。」

translations.text: Now not caring for the soldiers but indulging his private desires, not a minister of the state.'

sentences.zh: 項羽晨朝上將軍宋義，即其帳中斬宋義頭，出令軍中曰：「宋義與齊謀反楚，楚王陰令羽誅之。」

translations.text: Xiang Yu morning audience with Supreme General Song Yi, right in his tent beheaded Song Yi's head, issued orders in the army saying: 'Song Yi conspired with Qi to rebel against Chu, King Huai secretly ordered Yu to execute him.'

sentences.zh: 當是時，諸將皆慴服，莫敢枝梧。

translations.text: At this time, the generals all were awed and submissive, none dared to disobey.

sentences.zh: 皆曰：「首立楚者，將軍家也。

translations.text: All said: 'First to establish Chu was the general's family.

sentences.zh: 今將軍誅亂。」

translations.text: Now the general executes the traitor.'

sentences.zh: 乃相與共立羽為假上將軍。

translations.text: They together established Yu as Acting Supreme General.

sentences.zh: 使人追宋義子，及之齊，殺之。

translations.text: Sent people to pursue Song Yi's son, caught him in Qi, killed him.

sentences.zh: 使桓楚報命於懷王。

translations.text: Sent Huan Chu to report to King Huai.

sentences.zh: 懷王因使項羽為上將軍，當陽君、蒲將軍皆屬項羽。

translations.text: King Huai then made Xiang Yu Supreme General, all the Chu army was under Xiang Yu's command.
