Chen Ying's mother said: 'I heard generals are like women's husbands, difficult to know. If we join Xiang Liang, we will become his subordinates. Better to go west alone.' Chen Ying sent messengers to Xiang Liang saying: 'My mother said generals are difficult to know. I wish to go west alone.' Xiang Liang was angry, attacked Chen Ying, defeated him. Chen Ying fled to Dongyang, Xiang Liang pursued and killed him. Xiang Liang took Dongyang, incorporated Chen Ying's troops, his forces grew to twenty thousand. Xiang Liang then led troops west, camped at Xiapi. At this time, Liu Ji was serving as magistrate of Pei, recruited troops, got several thousand men. Xiang Liang sent messengers to Liu Ji, wishing to join forces. Liu Ji's counselor Cao Can said: 'Xiang Liang is brave and has merit, but cannot be subordinate to.' Liu Ji was hesitant. Cao Can said: 'If we go, we will become his subordinates; if we don't go, he will attack us.' Liu Ji said: 'Then what to do?' With Qin's strength, attacking the newly established Zhao, they will certainly take Zhao. If Zhao falls and Qin grows stronger, what exhaustion to inherit! Moreover, the state's army was newly defeated, the king cannot sit at ease, sweeps the realm and entrusts it all to the general, the nation's safety and danger, depends on this one action. Now not caring for the soldiers but indulging his private desires, not a minister of the state.' Xiang Yu morning audience with Supreme General Song Yi, right in his tent beheaded Song Yi's head, issued orders in the army saying: 'Song Yi conspired with Qi to rebel against Chu, King Huai secretly ordered Yu to execute him.' At this time, the generals all were awed and submissive, none dared to disobey. All said: 'First to establish Chu was the general's family. Now the general executes the traitor.' They together established Yu as Acting Supreme General. Sent people to pursue Song Yi's son, caught him in Qi, killed him. Sent Huan Chu to report to King Huai. King Huai then made Xiang Yu Supreme General, all the Chu army was under Xiang Yu's command.

sentences.zh: 項羽已殺卿子冠軍，威震楚國，名聞諸侯。

translations.text: When Xiang Yu heard that Qin had besieged Zhao at Julu, Xiang Yu wished to attack Qin.

sentences.zh: 乃遣當陽君、蒲將軍將卒二萬渡河，救鉅鹿。

translations.text: He sent Ying Bu and Pu to lead two thousand cavalry, broke through the encirclement, entered Julu, rescued Zhao.

sentences.zh: 戰少利，陳餘復請兵。

translations.text: When the Qin army retreated, Xiang Yu pursued and attacked, greatly defeated Qin at Julu.

sentences.zh: 項羽乃悉引兵渡河，皆沈船，破釜甑，燒廬舍，持三日糧，以示士卒必死，無一還心。

translations.text: The Qin generals Wang Li surrendered, Xiang Yu made Wang Li and Sima Xin his subordinates.

sentences.zh: 於是至則圍王離，與秦軍遇，九戰，絕其甬道，大破之，殺蘇角，虜王離。

translations.text: At this time, the princes' armies numbered hundreds of thousands, all camped outside Julu's siege lines.

sentences.zh: 涉閒不降楚，自燒殺。

translations.text: But none dared to fight Qin.

sentences.zh: 當是時，楚兵冠諸侯。

translations.text: When Xiang Yu attacked Qin, none followed.

sentences.zh: 諸侯軍救鉅鹿下者十餘壁，莫敢縱兵。

translations.text: Xiang Yu said: 'The world is in chaos, ghosts and spirits are moving, it is the time for great action.'

sentences.zh: 及楚擊秦，諸將皆從壁上觀。

translations.text: He forged a letter from King Huai saying: 'Whoever attacks Qin first, their general will be made King of Western Chu.'

sentences.zh: 楚戰士無不一以當十，楚兵呼聲動天，諸侯軍無不人人惴恐。

translations.text: Xiang Yu then first crossed the Yellow River, sank boats, smashed cooking pots, burned tents, only carried three days rations, to show determination to fight to the death.

sentences.zh: 於是已破秦軍，項羽召見諸侯將，入轅門，無不膝行而前，莫敢仰視。

translations.text: The army numbered twenty-eight thousand men, all Chu warriors, attacked Qin at Xin'an.

sentences.zh: 項羽由是始為諸侯上將軍，諸侯皆屬焉。

translations.text: When the Chu army reached, the Qin army was still besieging Zhao at Julu.

When Xiang Yu heard that Qin had besieged Zhao at Julu, Xiang Yu wished to attack Qin. He sent Ying Bu and Pu to lead two thousand cavalry, broke through the encirclement, entered Julu, rescued Zhao. When the Qin army retreated, Xiang Yu pursued and attacked, greatly defeated Qin at Julu. The Qin generals Wang Li surrendered, Xiang Yu made Wang Li and Sima Xin his subordinates. At this time, the princes' armies numbered hundreds of thousands, all camped outside Julu's siege lines. But none dared to fight Qin. When Xiang Yu attacked Qin, none followed. Xiang Yu said: 'The world is in chaos, ghosts and spirits are moving, it is the time for great action.' He forged a letter from King Huai saying: 'Whoever attacks Qin first, their general will be made King of Western Chu.' Xiang Yu then first crossed the Yellow River, sank boats, smashed cooking pots, burned tents, only carried three days rations, to show determination to fight to the death. The army numbered twenty-eight thousand men, all Chu warriors, attacked Qin at Xin'an. When the Chu army reached, the Qin army was still besieging Zhao at Julu.

sentences.zh: 章邯軍棘原，項羽軍漳南，相持未戰。

translations.text: Xiang Yu sent messengers to the princes saying: 'Our army has provisions for three days, please follow us to fight Qin.'

sentences.zh: 秦軍數卻，二世使人讓章邯。

translations.text: The princes said: 'We dare not advance, but hope the general will fight Qin.'

sentences.zh: 章邯恐，使長史欣請事。

translations.text: Xiang Yu then led twenty thousand men to fight Qin at Julu.

sentences.zh: 至咸陽，留司馬門三日，趙高不見，有不信之心。

translations.text: Xiang Yu's army was hungry and tired, but he made a great battle, defeated Qin forces.

sentences.zh: 長史欣恐，還走其軍，不敢出故道，趙高果使人追之，不及。

translations.text: Xiang Yu then led the princes' armies south, attacked Qin at Julu again.

sentences.zh: 欣至軍，報曰：「趙高用事於中，下無可為者。

translations.text: Xiang Yu's army was at the front, the princes' armies followed behind.

sentences.zh: 今戰能勝，高必疾妒吾功；

translations.text: When they reached the Yin Mountains, Xiang Yu ordered the princes' armies to cut paths through the mountains.

sentences.zh: 戰不能勝，不免於死。

translations.text: The princes' armies cut paths, Xiang Yu feared they would take advantage, secretly ordered the strong Chu army to follow behind and kill them.

sentences.zh: 願將軍孰計之。」

translations.text: When the princes' armies entered the passes, Xiang Yu sealed the passes, did not let them enter.

sentences.zh: 陳餘亦遺章邯書曰：「白起為秦將，南征鄢郢，北阬馬服，攻城略地，不可勝計，而竟賜死。

translations.text: He stationed troops to guard the passes, then led the Chu army west alone.

sentences.zh: 蒙恬為秦將，北逐戎人，開榆中地數千里，竟斬陽周。

translations.text: When Xiang Yu reached Hangu Pass, the Qin forces were still many.

sentences.zh: 何者？

translations.text: Xiang Yu attacked, defeated Qin, entered Hangu Pass.

sentences.zh: 功多，秦不能盡封，因以法誅之。

translations.text: Then advanced to Xianyang, attacked Qin forces at Xianyang.

sentences.zh: 今將軍為秦將三歲矣，所亡失以十萬數，而諸侯并起滋益多。

translations.text: Qin Er Shi sent Zhang Han to surrender.

sentences.zh: 彼趙高素諛日久，今事急，亦恐二世誅之，故欲以法誅將軍以塞責，使人更代將軍以脫其禍。

translations.text: Zhang Han said: 'Please allow me to report to the emperor.'

sentences.zh: 夫將軍居外久，多內卻，有功亦誅，無功亦誅。

translations.text: Zhang Han returned, Qin Er Shi hanged himself.

sentences.zh: 且天之亡秦，無愚智皆知之。

translations.text: Zhang Han then surrendered to Xiang Yu at Xianyang.

sentences.zh: 今將軍內不能直諫，外為亡國將，孤特獨立而欲常存，豈不哀哉！

translations.text: Xiang Yu then burned and plundered Xianyang, killed Ziying, the Qin prince.

sentences.zh: 將軍何不還兵與諸侯為從，約共攻秦，分王其地，南面稱孤；

translations.text: Xiang Yu then returned east, camped at Hongmen.

sentences.zh: 此孰與身伏鈇質，妻子為僇乎？」

translations.text: He ordered the princes to divide Qin territory.

sentences.zh: 章邯狐疑，陰使候始成使項羽，欲約。

translations.text: He established Zhang Han as Yong King, with Yong as capital.

sentences.zh: 約未成，項羽使蒲將軍日夜引兵度三戶，軍漳南，與秦戰，再破之。

translations.text: Established Sima Xin as Sai King, with Feiqiu as capital.

sentences.zh: 項羽悉引兵擊秦軍汙水上，大破之。

translations.text: Established Dong Yi as Di King, with Gao as capital.

Xiang Yu sent messengers to the princes saying: 'Our army has provisions for three days, please follow us to fight Qin.' The princes said: 'We dare not advance, but hope the general will fight Qin.' Xiang Yu then led twenty thousand men to fight Qin at Julu. Xiang Yu's army was hungry and tired, but he made a great battle, defeated Qin forces. Xiang Yu then led the princes' armies south, attacked Qin at Julu again. Xiang Yu's army was at the front, the princes' armies followed behind. When they reached the Yin Mountains, Xiang Yu ordered the princes' armies to cut paths through the mountains. The princes' armies cut paths, Xiang Yu feared they would take advantage, secretly ordered the strong Chu army to follow behind and kill them. When the princes' armies entered the passes, Xiang Yu sealed the passes, did not let them enter. He stationed troops to guard the passes, then led the Chu army west alone. When Xiang Yu reached Hangu Pass, the Qin forces were still many. Xiang Yu attacked, defeated Qin, entered Hangu Pass. Then advanced to Xianyang, attacked Qin forces at Xianyang. Qin Er Shi sent Zhang Han to surrender. Zhang Han said: 'Please allow me to report to the emperor.' Zhang Han returned, Qin Er Shi hanged himself. Zhang Han then surrendered to Xiang Yu at Xianyang. Xiang Yu then burned and plundered Xianyang, killed Ziying, the Qin prince. Xiang Yu then returned east, camped at Hongmen. He ordered the princes to divide Qin territory. He established Zhang Han as Yong King, with Yong as capital. Established Sima Xin as Sai King, with Feiqiu as capital. Established Dong Yi as Di King, with Gao as capital.

sentences.zh: 章邯使人見項羽，欲約。

translations.text: Established Zhao Xiong as Zhao King, with Zhao as capital.

sentences.zh: 項羽召軍吏謀曰：「糧少，欲聽其約。」

translations.text: Established Tian Rong as Qi King, with Qi as capital.

sentences.zh: 軍吏皆曰：「善。」

translations.text: Established Han Guang as Yan King, with Ji as capital.

sentences.zh: 項羽乃與期洹水南殷虛上。

translations.text: Established Wei Bao as Wei King, with Pingyang as capital.

sentences.zh: 已盟，章邯見項羽而流涕，為言趙高。

translations.text: Established Sima Ang as Dai King, with Dai as capital.

sentences.zh: 項羽乃立章邯為雍王，置楚軍中。

translations.text: Established Zhang Er as Zhao King, with Zhao as capital.

sentences.zh: 使長史欣為上將軍，將秦軍為前行。

translations.text: Established Wu Chen as Hengshan King, with Hengshan as capital.

Established Zhao Xiong as Zhao King, with Zhao as capital. Established Tian Rong as Qi King, with Qi as capital. Established Han Guang as Yan King, with Ji as capital. Established Wei Bao as Wei King, with Pingyang as capital. Established Sima Ang as Dai King, with Dai as capital. Established Zhang Er as Zhao King, with Zhao as capital. Established Wu Chen as Hengshan King, with Hengshan as capital.

sentences.zh: 到新安。

translations.text: Established Gong Ao as Linhuai King, with Linhuai as capital.

sentences.zh: 諸侯吏卒異時故繇使屯戍過秦中，秦中吏卒遇之多無狀，及秦軍降諸侯，諸侯吏卒乘勝多奴虜使之，輕折辱秦吏卒。

translations.text: Established Xiang Yu as Western Chu Overlord, with Pengcheng as capital.

sentences.zh: 秦吏卒多竊言曰：「章將軍等詐吾屬降諸侯，今能入關破秦，大善；

translations.text: Xiang Yu said: 'The world is in chaos, ghosts and spirits are moving, it is the time for great action.'

sentences.zh: 即不能，諸侯虜吾屬而東，秦必盡誅吾父母妻子。」

translations.text: He forged a letter from King Huai saying: 'Whoever attacks Qin first, their general will be made King of Western Chu.'

sentences.zh: 諸侯微聞其計，以告項羽。

translations.text: Xiang Yu then first crossed the Yellow River, sank boats, smashed cooking pots, burned tents, only carried three days rations, to show determination to fight to the death.

sentences.zh: 項羽乃召黥布、蒲將軍計曰：「秦吏卒尚眾，其心不服，至關中不聽，事必危，不如擊殺之，而獨與章邯、長史欣、都尉翳入秦。」

translations.text: The army numbered twenty-eight thousand men, all Chu warriors, attacked Qin at Xin'an.

sentences.zh: 於是楚軍夜擊阬秦卒二十餘萬人新安城南。

translations.text: Therefore the Chu army night attacked and buried alive over 200,000 Qin soldiers south of Xin'an city.

Established Gong Ao as Linhuai King, with Linhuai as capital. Established Xiang Yu as Western Chu Overlord, with Pengcheng as capital. Xiang Yu said: 'The world is in chaos, ghosts and spirits are moving, it is the time for great action.' He forged a letter from King Huai saying: 'Whoever attacks Qin first, their general will be made King of Western Chu.' Xiang Yu then first crossed the Yellow River, sank boats, smashed cooking pots, burned tents, only carried three days rations, to show determination to fight to the death. The army numbered twenty-eight thousand men, all Chu warriors, attacked Qin at Xin'an. Therefore the Chu army night attacked and buried alive over 200,000 Qin soldiers south of Xin'an city.

sentences.zh: 行略定秦地。

translations.text: Then proceeded to pacify Qin territory.

sentences.zh: 函谷關有兵守關，不得入。

translations.text: Hangu Pass had troops guarding the pass, could not enter.

sentences.zh: 又聞沛公已破咸陽，項羽大怒，使當陽君等擊關。

translations.text: He also heard Liu Bang had already taken Xianyang, Xiang Yu greatly angered, sent Dangyang Jun and others to attack the pass.

sentences.zh: 項羽遂入，至于戲西。

translations.text: Xiang Yu then entered, reached Xi west.

sentences.zh: 沛公軍霸上，未得與項羽相見。

translations.text: Liu Bang's army was at Bashang, could not meet with Xiang Yu.

sentences.zh: 沛公左司馬曹無傷使人言於項羽曰：「沛公欲王關中，使子嬰為相，珍寶盡有之。」

translations.text: Liu Bang's Left Marshal Cao Wushang sent someone to speak to Xiang Yu saying: 'Liu Bang wishes to be king of Guanzhong, make Ziying prime minister, all precious treasures will belong to you.'

sentences.zh: 項羽大怒，曰：「旦日饗士卒，為擊破沛公軍！」

translations.text: Xiang Yu greatly angered, said: 'Tomorrow feast the soldiers, to attack and defeat Liu Bang's army!'

sentences.zh: 當是時，項羽兵四十萬，在新豐鴻門，沛公兵十萬，在霸上。

translations.text: At this time, Xiang Yu had 400,000 troops, at Xinfeng Hongmen, Liu Bang had 100,000 troops, at Bashang.

sentences.zh: 范增說項羽曰：「沛公居山東時，貪於財貨，好美姬。

translations.text: Fan Zeng advised Xiang Yu saying: 'When Liu Bang was in Shandong, greedy for wealth and goods, fond of beautiful women.

sentences.zh: 今入關，財物無所取，婦女無所幸，此其志不在小。

translations.text: Now entered the pass, wealth and goods he takes nothing, women he does not favor, this shows his ambitions are not small.

sentences.zh: 吾令人望其氣，皆為龍虎，成五采，此天子氣也。

translations.text: Please kill him quickly, do not delay.'

sentences.zh: 急擊勿失。」

translations.text: Xiang Yu said: 'Don't kill him.'

Then proceeded to pacify Qin territory. Hangu Pass had troops guarding the pass, could not enter. He also heard Liu Bang had already taken Xianyang, Xiang Yu greatly angered, sent Dangyang Jun and others to attack the pass. Xiang Yu then entered, reached Xi west. Liu Bang's army was at Bashang, could not meet with Xiang Yu. Liu Bang's Left Marshal Cao Wushang sent someone to speak to Xiang Yu saying: 'Liu Bang wishes to be king of Guanzhong, make Ziying prime minister, all precious treasures will belong to you.' Xiang Yu greatly angered, said: 'Tomorrow feast the soldiers, to attack and defeat Liu Bang's army!' At this time, Xiang Yu had 400,000 troops, at Xinfeng Hongmen, Liu Bang had 100,000 troops, at Bashang. Fan Zeng advised Xiang Yu saying: 'When Liu Bang was in Shandong, greedy for wealth and goods, fond of beautiful women. Now entered the pass, wealth and goods he takes nothing, women he does not favor, this shows his ambitions are not small. Please kill him quickly, do not delay.' Xiang Yu said: 'Don't kill him.'

sentences.zh: 楚左尹項伯者，項羽季父也，素善留侯張良。

translations.text: Fan Zeng sent Xiang Zhuang to banquet in the army tent, to make Xiang Zhuang dance with sword, take opportunity to strike Liu Bang.

sentences.zh: 張良是時從沛公，項伯乃夜馳之沛公軍，私見張良，具告以事，欲呼張良與俱去。

translations.text: Xiang Zhuang danced with sword, Xiang Yu rose and toasted, saying: 'The prince cannot dance.'

sentences.zh: 曰：「毋從俱死也。」

translations.text: Xiang Zhuang then stopped.

sentences.zh: 張良曰：「臣為韓王送沛公，沛公今事有急，亡去不義，不可不語。」

translations.text: Fan Zeng beckoned the waiter to come, wished to strike the jade ring as signal to attack.

sentences.zh: 良乃入，具告沛公。

translations.text: The waiter understood, struck the jade ring.

sentences.zh: 沛公大驚，曰：「為之柰何？」

translations.text: Xiang Bo saw this, went out and told Zhang Liang.

sentences.zh: 張良曰：「誰為大王為此計者？」

translations.text: Zhang Liang went in and told Liu Bang.

sentences.zh: 曰：「鯫生說我曰『距關，毋內諸侯，秦地可盡王也』。

translations.text: Liu Bang said: 'What to do?'

sentences.zh: 故聽之。」

translations.text: Zhang Liang said: 'Let me go out first.'

sentences.zh: 良曰：「料大王士卒足以當項王乎？」

translations.text: Zhang Liang went out, Fan Zeng entered, saw Liu Bang still sitting calmly drinking.

sentences.zh: 沛公默然，曰：「固不如也，且為之柰何？」

translations.text: Fan Zeng said: 'The prince is brave!'

sentences.zh: 張良曰：「請往謂項伯，言沛公不敢背項王也。」

translations.text: Then went out, called Xiang Zhuang to enter.

sentences.zh: 沛公曰：「君安與項伯有故？」

translations.text: Xiang Zhuang entered, Fan Zeng blocked the door and said: 'The prince wishes to give you a sword dance.'

sentences.zh: 張良曰：「秦時與臣游，項伯殺人，臣活之。

translations.text: Xiang Zhuang danced with sword, Fan Zeng wished to strike Liu Bang.

sentences.zh: 今事有急，故幸來告良。」

translations.text: Xiang Zhuang hesitated.

sentences.zh: 沛公曰「孰與君少長？」

translations.text: Liu Bang rose to relieve himself, wished to leave.

sentences.zh: 良曰：「長於臣。」

translations.text: Fan Kuai said: 'Now the matter is urgent, let me go in and protect.'

sentences.zh: 沛公曰「君為我呼入，吾得兄事之。」

translations.text: Fan Kuai carried a sword and shield, entered the tent, sat with back to the wall, glared at Xiang Zhuang.

sentences.zh: 張良出，要項伯。

translations.text: Xiang Zhuang stopped dancing.

sentences.zh: 項伯即入見沛公。

translations.text: Fan Kuai scolded Xiang Yu saying: 'My lord established you as king, you received the Chu king's order to attack Qin, now Qin is destroyed, you should divide the land to enfeoff the princes.

sentences.zh: 沛公奉卮酒為壽，約為婚姻，曰：「吾入關，秋豪不敢有所近，籍吏民，封府庫，而待將軍。

translations.text: Now you wish to kill the meritorious, this is the way to destroy Chu.'

sentences.zh: 所以遣將守關者，備他盜之出入與非常也。

translations.text: Xiang Yu could not reply, said: 'Sit and drink.'

sentences.zh: 日夜望將軍至，豈敢反乎！

translations.text: Fan Kuai sat and drank with Liu Bang.

sentences.zh: 願伯具言臣之不敢倍德也。」

translations.text: Liu Bang left to relieve himself, Fan Kuai followed out.

sentences.zh: 項伯許諾。

translations.text: Liu Bang said: 'The matter is urgent, I cannot return.'

sentences.zh: 謂沛公曰：「旦日不可不蚤自來謝項王。」

translations.text: He called Zhang Liang to stay, gave him white jade ring as thanks to Xiang Yu.

sentences.zh: 沛公曰：「諾。」

translations.text: Liu Bang rode alone, fled through Xiaopi.

sentences.zh: 於是項伯復夜去，至軍中，具以沛公言報項王。

translations.text: Zhang Liang entered, Xiang Yu asked where Liu Bang was.

sentences.zh: 因言曰：「沛公不先破關中，公豈敢入乎？

translations.text: Zhang Liang said: 'He left suddenly, saying he had urgent business.'

sentences.zh: 今人有大功而擊之，不義也，不如因善遇之。」

translations.text: Xiang Yu said: 'The prince is polite.'

sentences.zh: 項王許諾。

translations.text: Then gave the white jade ring to Zhang Liang.

Fan Zeng sent Xiang Zhuang to banquet in the army tent, to make Xiang Zhuang dance with sword, take opportunity to strike Liu Bang. Xiang Zhuang danced with sword, Xiang Yu rose and toasted, saying: 'The prince cannot dance.' Xiang Zhuang then stopped. Fan Zeng beckoned the waiter to come, wished to strike the jade ring as signal to attack. The waiter understood, struck the jade ring. Xiang Bo saw this, went out and told Zhang Liang. Zhang Liang went in and told Liu Bang. Liu Bang said: 'What to do?' Zhang Liang said: 'Let me go out first.' Zhang Liang went out, Fan Zeng entered, saw Liu Bang still sitting calmly drinking. Fan Zeng said: 'The prince is brave!' Then went out, called Xiang Zhuang to enter. Xiang Zhuang entered, Fan Zeng blocked the door and said: 'The prince wishes to give you a sword dance.' Xiang Zhuang danced with sword, Fan Zeng wished to strike Liu Bang. Xiang Zhuang hesitated. Liu Bang rose to relieve himself, wished to leave. Fan Kuai said: 'Now the matter is urgent, let me go in and protect.' Fan Kuai carried a sword and shield, entered the tent, sat with back to the wall, glared at Xiang Zhuang. Xiang Zhuang stopped dancing. Fan Kuai scolded Xiang Yu saying: 'My lord established you as king, you received the Chu king's order to attack Qin, now Qin is destroyed, you should divide the land to enfeoff the princes. Now you wish to kill the meritorious, this is the way to destroy Chu.' Xiang Yu could not reply, said: 'Sit and drink.' Fan Kuai sat and drank with Liu Bang. Liu Bang left to relieve himself, Fan Kuai followed out. Liu Bang said: 'The matter is urgent, I cannot return.' He called Zhang Liang to stay, gave him white jade ring as thanks to Xiang Yu. Liu Bang rode alone, fled through Xiaopi. Zhang Liang entered, Xiang Yu asked where Liu Bang was. Zhang Liang said: 'He left suddenly, saying he had urgent business.' Xiang Yu said: 'The prince is polite.' Then gave the white jade ring to Zhang Liang.

sentences.zh: 沛公旦日從百餘騎來見項王，至鴻門，謝曰：「臣與將軍戮力而攻秦，將軍戰河北，臣戰河南，然不自意能先入關破秦，得復見將軍於此。

translations.text: Xiang Yu camped at Hongmen, Liu Bang camped at Bashang.

sentences.zh: 今者有小人之言，令將軍與臣有郤。」

translations.text: Xiang Yu made Liu Bang king of Han, with Bashang as capital.

sentences.zh: 項王曰：「此沛公左司馬曹無傷言之；

translations.text: Xiang Yu then returned east.

sentences.zh: 不然，籍何以至此。」

translations.text: King Huai of Chu heard Xiang Yu had made kings in the west, was angry, wished to attack Xiang Yu.

sentences.zh: 項王即日因留沛公與飲。

translations.text: Xiang Yu heard this, sent Ying Bu to kill King Huai at Chen, buried him at Yinling.

sentences.zh: 項王、項伯東向坐。

translations.text: Xiang Yu then summoned the princes to Jibei to swear alliance.

sentences.zh: 亞父南向坐。

translations.text: He made Tian Rong king of Qi, with Linzi as capital.

sentences.zh: 亞父者，范增也。

translations.text: Made Peng Yue king of Liang, with Xiapei as capital.

sentences.zh: 沛公北向坐，張良西向侍。

translations.text: Made Han Xin king of Chu, with Chu as capital.

sentences.zh: 范增數目項王，舉所佩玉珪以示之者三，項王默然不應。

translations.text: Made Ying Bu king of Jiujiang, with Jiujiang as capital.

sentences.zh: 范增起，出召項莊，謂曰：「君王為人不忍，若入前為壽，壽畢，請以劍舞，因擊沛公於坐，殺之。

translations.text: Made Wu Rui king of Hengshan, with Hengshan as capital.

sentences.zh: 不者，若屬皆且為所虜。」

translations.text: Made Gong Ao king of Linhuai, with Linhuai as capital.

sentences.zh: 莊則入為壽，壽畢，曰：「君王與沛公飲，軍中無以為樂，請以劍舞。」

translations.text: Made Zang Tu king of Yan, with Yan as capital.

sentences.zh: 項王曰：「諾。」

translations.text: Made Zhang Er king of Changshan, with Changshan as capital.

sentences.zh: 項莊拔劍起舞，項伯亦拔劍起舞，常以身翼蔽沛公，莊不得擊。

translations.text: Made Wei Bao king of Wei, with Pingyang as capital.

sentences.zh: 於是張良至軍門，見樊噲。

translations.text: Made Sima Ang king of Dai, with Dai as capital.

sentences.zh: 樊噲曰：「今日之事何如？」

translations.text: Fan Kuai said: 'How is today's matter?'

sentences.zh: 良曰：「甚急。

translations.text: Zhang Liang said: 'Very urgent.

sentences.zh: 今者項莊拔劍舞，其意常在沛公也。」

translations.text: Now Xiang Zhuang draws his sword and dances, his intention is always on Liu Bang.'

sentences.zh: 噲曰：「此迫矣，臣請入，與之同命。」

translations.text: Fan Kuai said: 'This is urgent, I request to enter and die with him.'

sentences.zh: 噲即帶劍擁盾入軍門。

translations.text: Fan Kuai immediately carried sword and shield, entered the army gate.

sentences.zh: 交戟之衛士欲止不內，樊噲側其盾以撞，衛士仆地，噲遂入，披帷西向立，瞋目視項王，頭髪上指，目眥盡裂。

translations.text: The halberd-crossing guards wished to stop him from entering, Fan Kuai tilted his shield to strike, guards fell to the ground, Fan Kuai then entered, parted the curtain and stood facing west, glared at Xiang Yu, his hair stood on end, his eyes were bloodshot to the corners.

sentences.zh: 項王按劍而跽曰：「客何為者？」

translations.text: Xiang Yu pressed his sword and knelt saying: 'Guest, what are you doing?'

sentences.zh: 張良曰：「沛公之參乘樊噲者也。」

translations.text: Zhang Liang said: 'He is Liu Bang's chariot companion Fan Kuai.'

sentences.zh: 項王曰：「壯士，賜之卮酒。」

translations.text: Xiang Yu said: 'Brave warrior, give him a cup of wine.'

sentences.zh: 則與斗卮酒。

translations.text: Then gave him a large cup of wine.

sentences.zh: 噲拜謝，起，立而飲之。

translations.text: Fan Kuai bowed and thanked, rose, stood and drank it.

sentences.zh: 項王曰：「賜之彘肩。」

translations.text: Xiang Yu said: 'Brave warrior, give him a pork shoulder.'

sentences.zh: 則與一生彘肩。

translations.text: Fan Kuai took the pork shoulder, put it on his shield, and ate it raw.

sentences.zh: 樊噲覆其盾於地，加彘肩上，拔劍切而啗之。

translations.text: Xiang Yu said: 'Brave warrior, can you still drink?'

sentences.zh: 項王曰：「壯士，能復飲乎？」

translations.text: Fan Kuai said: 'I dare not refuse death, how dare I refuse wine!

sentences.zh: 樊噲曰：「臣死且不避，卮酒安足辭！

translations.text: Today I came to fight, not to drink.'

sentences.zh: 夫秦王有虎狼之心，殺人如不能舉，刑人如恐不勝，天下皆叛之。

translations.text: Xiang Yu said: 'Give him a seat.'

sentences.zh: 懷王與諸將約曰『先破秦入咸陽者王之』。

translations.text: Fan Kuai sat next to Zhang Liang.

sentences.zh: 今沛公先破秦入咸陽，豪毛不敢有所近，封閉宮室，還軍霸上，以待大王來。

translations.text: After a short while, Liu Bang rose to relieve himself.

sentences.zh: 故遣將守關者，備他盜出入與非常也。

translations.text: Fan Kuai wished to follow.

sentences.zh: 勞苦而功高如此，未有封侯之賞，而聽細說，欲誅有功之人。

translations.text: Liu Bang said: 'The matter is urgent, I cannot return.'

sentences.zh: 此亡秦之續耳，竊為大王不取也。」

translations.text: He called Zhang Liang to stay, gave him the white jade ring as thanks to Xiang Yu.

sentences.zh: 項王未有以應，曰：「坐。」

translations.text: Liu Bang rode alone, fled through Xiaopi.

sentences.zh: 樊噲從良坐。

translations.text: Zhang Liang entered, Xiang Yu asked where Liu Bang was.

sentences.zh: 坐須臾，沛公起如廁，因招樊噲出。

translations.text: Zhang Liang said: 'He left suddenly, saying he had urgent business.'

Xiang Yu camped at Hongmen, Liu Bang camped at Bashang. Xiang Yu made Liu Bang king of Han, with Bashang as capital. Xiang Yu then returned east. King Huai of Chu heard Xiang Yu had made kings in the west, was angry, wished to attack Xiang Yu. Xiang Yu heard this, sent Ying Bu to kill King Huai at Chen, buried him at Yinling. Xiang Yu then summoned the princes to Jibei to swear alliance. He made Tian Rong king of Qi, with Linzi as capital. Made Peng Yue king of Liang, with Xiapei as capital. Made Han Xin king of Chu, with Chu as capital. Made Ying Bu king of Jiujiang, with Jiujiang as capital. Made Wu Rui king of Hengshan, with Hengshan as capital. Made Gong Ao king of Linhuai, with Linhuai as capital. Made Zang Tu king of Yan, with Yan as capital. Made Zhang Er king of Changshan, with Changshan as capital. Made Wei Bao king of Wei, with Pingyang as capital. Made Sima Ang king of Dai, with Dai as capital. Fan Kuai said: 'How is today's matter?' Zhang Liang said: 'Very urgent. Now Xiang Zhuang draws his sword and dances, his intention is always on Liu Bang.' Fan Kuai said: 'This is urgent, I request to enter and die with him.' Fan Kuai immediately carried sword and shield, entered the army gate. The halberd-crossing guards wished to stop him from entering, Fan Kuai tilted his shield to strike, guards fell to the ground, Fan Kuai then entered, parted the curtain and stood facing west, glared at Xiang Yu, his hair stood on end, his eyes were bloodshot to the corners. Xiang Yu pressed his sword and knelt saying: 'Guest, what are you doing?' Zhang Liang said: 'He is Liu Bang's chariot companion Fan Kuai.' Xiang Yu said: 'Brave warrior, give him a cup of wine.' Then gave him a large cup of wine. Fan Kuai bowed and thanked, rose, stood and drank it. Xiang Yu said: 'Brave warrior, give him a pork shoulder.' Fan Kuai took the pork shoulder, put it on his shield, and ate it raw. Xiang Yu said: 'Brave warrior, can you still drink?' Fan Kuai said: 'I dare not refuse death, how dare I refuse wine! Today I came to fight, not to drink.' Xiang Yu said: 'Give him a seat.' Fan Kuai sat next to Zhang Liang. After a short while, Liu Bang rose to relieve himself. Fan Kuai wished to follow. Liu Bang said: 'The matter is urgent, I cannot return.' He called Zhang Liang to stay, gave him the white jade ring as thanks to Xiang Yu. Liu Bang rode alone, fled through Xiaopi. Zhang Liang entered, Xiang Yu asked where Liu Bang was. Zhang Liang said: 'He left suddenly, saying he had urgent business.'

sentences.zh: 沛公已出，項王使都尉陳平召沛公。

translations.text: Xiang Yu said: 'The prince is polite.'

sentences.zh: 沛公曰：「今者出，未辭也，為之柰何？」

translations.text: Then gave the white jade ring to Zhang Liang.

sentences.zh: 樊噲曰：「大行不顧細謹，大禮不辭小讓。

translations.text: Xiang Yu camped at Hongmen, Liu Bang camped at Bashang.

sentences.zh: 如今人方為刀俎，我為魚肉，何辭為。」

translations.text: Xiang Yu made Liu Bang king of Han, with Bashang as capital.

sentences.zh: 於是遂去。

translations.text: Xiang Yu then returned east.

sentences.zh: 乃令張良留謝。

translations.text: King Huai of Chu heard Xiang Yu had made kings in the west, was angry, wished to attack Xiang Yu.

sentences.zh: 良問曰：「大王來何操？」

translations.text: Xiang Yu heard this, sent Ying Bu to kill King Huai at Chen, buried him at Yinling.

sentences.zh: 曰：「我持白璧一雙，欲獻項王，玉斗一雙，欲與亞父，會其怒，不敢獻。

translations.text: Xiang Yu then summoned the princes to Jibei to swear alliance.

sentences.zh: 公為我獻之」張良曰：「謹諾。」

translations.text: He made Tian Rong king of Qi, with Linzi as capital.

sentences.zh: 當是時，項王軍在鴻門下，沛公軍在霸上，相去四十里。

translations.text: Made Peng Yue king of Liang, with Xiapei as capital.

sentences.zh: 沛公則置車騎，脫身獨騎，與樊噲、夏侯嬰、靳彊、紀信等四人持劍盾步走，從酈山下，道芷陽閒行。

translations.text: Made Han Xin king of Chu, with Chu as capital.

sentences.zh: 沛公謂張良曰：「從此道至吾軍，不過二十里耳。

translations.text: Made Ying Bu king of Jiujiang, with Jiujiang as capital.

sentences.zh: 度我至軍中，公乃入。」

translations.text: Made Wu Rui king of Hengshan, with Hengshan as capital.

sentences.zh: 沛公已去，閒至軍中，張良入謝，曰：「沛公不勝桮杓，不能辭。

translations.text: Made Gong Ao king of Linhuai, with Linhuai as capital.

sentences.zh: 謹使臣良奉白璧一雙，再拜獻大王足下；

translations.text: Made Zang Tu king of Yan, with Yan as capital.

sentences.zh: 玉斗一雙，再拜奉大將軍足下。」

translations.text: Made Zhang Er king of Changshan, with Changshan as capital.

sentences.zh: 項王曰：「沛公安在？」

translations.text: Made Wei Bao king of Wei, with Pingyang as capital.

sentences.zh: 良曰：「聞大王有意督過之，脫身獨去，已至軍矣。」

translations.text: Made Sima Ang king of Dai, with Dai as capital.

sentences.zh: 項王則受璧，置之坐上。

translations.text: Xiang Yu said: 'The world is in chaos, ghosts and spirits are moving, it is the time for great action.'

sentences.zh: 亞父受玉斗，置之地，拔劍撞而破之，曰：「唉！

translations.text: He forged a letter from King Huai saying: 'Whoever attacks Qin first, their general will be made King of Western Chu.'

sentences.zh: 豎子不足與謀。

translations.text: Xiang Yu then first crossed the Yellow River, sank boats, smashed cooking pots, burned tents, only carried three days rations, to show determination to fight to the death.

sentences.zh: 奪項王天下者，必沛公也，吾屬今為之虜矣。」

translations.text: The army numbered twenty-eight thousand men, all Chu warriors, attacked Qin at Xin'an.

sentences.zh: 沛公至軍，立誅殺曹無傷。

translations.text: When the Chu army reached, the Qin army was still besieging Zhao at Julu.

Xiang Yu said: 'The prince is polite.' Then gave the white jade ring to Zhang Liang. Xiang Yu camped at Hongmen, Liu Bang camped at Bashang. Xiang Yu made Liu Bang king of Han, with Bashang as capital. Xiang Yu then returned east. King Huai of Chu heard Xiang Yu had made kings in the west, was angry, wished to attack Xiang Yu. Xiang Yu heard this, sent Ying Bu to kill King Huai at Chen, buried him at Yinling. Xiang Yu then summoned the princes to Jibei to swear alliance. He made Tian Rong king of Qi, with Linzi as capital. Made Peng Yue king of Liang, with Xiapei as capital. Made Han Xin king of Chu, with Chu as capital. Made Ying Bu king of Jiujiang, with Jiujiang as capital. Made Wu Rui king of Hengshan, with Hengshan as capital. Made Gong Ao king of Linhuai, with Linhuai as capital. Made Zang Tu king of Yan, with Yan as capital. Made Zhang Er king of Changshan, with Changshan as capital. Made Wei Bao king of Wei, with Pingyang as capital. Made Sima Ang king of Dai, with Dai as capital. Xiang Yu said: 'The world is in chaos, ghosts and spirits are moving, it is the time for great action.' He forged a letter from King Huai saying: 'Whoever attacks Qin first, their general will be made King of Western Chu.' Xiang Yu then first crossed the Yellow River, sank boats, smashed cooking pots, burned tents, only carried three days rations, to show determination to fight to the death. The army numbered twenty-eight thousand men, all Chu warriors, attacked Qin at Xin'an. When the Chu army reached, the Qin army was still besieging Zhao at Julu.

sentences.zh: 居數日，項羽引兵西屠咸陽，殺秦降王子嬰，燒秦宮室，火三月不滅；

translations.text: Xiang Yu sent messengers to the princes saying: 'Our army has provisions for three days, please follow us to fight Qin.'

sentences.zh: 收其貨寶婦女而東。

translations.text: The princes said: 'We dare not advance, but hope the general will fight Qin.'

sentences.zh: 人或說項王曰：「關中阻山河四塞，地肥饒，可都以霸。」

translations.text: Xiang Yu then led twenty thousand men to fight Qin at Julu.

sentences.zh: 項王見秦宮皆以燒殘破，又心懷思欲東歸，曰：「富貴不歸故鄉，如衣繡夜行，誰知之者！」

translations.text: Xiang Yu's army was hungry and tired, but he made a great battle, defeated Qin forces.

sentences.zh: 說者曰：「人言楚人沐猴而冠耳，果然。」

translations.text: Xiang Yu then led the princes' armies south, attacked Qin at Julu again.

sentences.zh: 項王聞之，烹說者。

translations.text: Xiang Yu's army was at the front, the princes' armies followed behind.

Xiang Yu sent messengers to the princes saying: 'Our army has provisions for three days, please follow us to fight Qin.' The princes said: 'We dare not advance, but hope the general will fight Qin.' Xiang Yu then led twenty thousand men to fight Qin at Julu. Xiang Yu's army was hungry and tired, but he made a great battle, defeated Qin forces. Xiang Yu then led the princes' armies south, attacked Qin at Julu again. Xiang Yu's army was at the front, the princes' armies followed behind.

sentences.zh: 項王使人致命懷王。

translations.text: When they reached the Yin Mountains, Xiang Yu ordered the princes' armies to cut paths through the mountains.

sentences.zh: 懷王曰：「如約。」

translations.text: The princes' armies cut paths, Xiang Yu feared they would take advantage, secretly ordered the strong Chu army to follow behind and kill them.

sentences.zh: 乃尊懷王為義帝。

translations.text: When the princes' armies entered the passes, Xiang Yu sealed the passes, did not let them enter.

sentences.zh: 項王欲自王，先王諸將相。

translations.text: He stationed troops to guard the passes, then led the Chu army west alone.

sentences.zh: 謂曰：「天下初發難時，假立諸侯後以伐秦。

translations.text: When Xiang Yu reached Hangu Pass, the Qin forces were still many.

sentences.zh: 然身被堅執銳首事，暴露於野三年，滅秦定天下者，皆將相諸君與籍之力也。

translations.text: Xiang Yu attacked, defeated Qin, entered Hangu Pass.

sentences.zh: 義帝雖無功，故當分其地而王之。」

translations.text: King Yi though without merit, should still divide land and make him king.'

sentences.zh: 諸將皆曰：「善。」

translations.text: The generals all said: 'Good.'

sentences.zh: 乃分天下，立諸將為侯王。

translations.text: Then divided the world, established the generals as marquises and kings.

sentences.zh: 項王、范增疑沛公之有天下，業已講解，又惡負約，恐諸侯叛之，乃陰謀曰：「巴、蜀道險，秦之遷人皆居蜀。」

translations.text: Xiang Yu and Fan Zeng suspected Liu Bang of having ambitions for the world, but having already made peace, and fearing to break the agreement and cause the lords to rebel, secretly plotted saying: 'The roads to Ba and Shu are dangerous, Qin's exiled people all live in Shu.'

sentences.zh: 乃曰：「巴、蜀亦關中地也。」

translations.text: Then said: 'Ba and Shu are also Guanzhong territory.'

sentences.zh: 故立沛公為漢王，王巴、蜀、漢中，都南鄭。

translations.text: Therefore established Liu Bang as Han King, ruling Ba, Shu, Hanzhong, with capital at Nanzheng.

sentences.zh: 而三分關中，王秦降將以距塞漢王。

translations.text: And divided Guanzhong into three, made Qin surrendering generals kings to block Han King.

sentences.zh: 項王乃立章邯為雍王，王咸陽以西，都廢丘。

translations.text: Xiang Yu then established Zhang Han as Yong King, ruling west of Xianyang, with capital at Feiqiu.

sentences.zh: 長史欣者，故為櫟陽獄掾，嘗有德於項梁；

translations.text: Chief Scribe Xin was formerly Queyang prison clerk, once had kindness to Xiang Liang;

sentences.zh: 都尉董翳者，本勸章邯降楚。

translations.text: Colonel Dong Yi originally advised Zhang Han to surrender to Chu.

sentences.zh: 故立司馬欣為塞王，王咸陽以東至河，都櫟陽；

translations.text: Therefore established Sima Xin as Sai King, ruling east of Xianyang to the Yellow River, with capital at Queyang;

sentences.zh: 立董翳為翟王，王上郡，都高奴。

translations.text: Established Dong Yi as Di King, ruling Shangjun, with capital at Gao.

sentences.zh: 徙魏王豹為西魏王，王河東，都平陽。

translations.text: When the division was completed, Xiang Yu wished to march east.

sentences.zh: 瑕丘申陽者，張耳嬖臣也，先下河南（郡），迎楚河上，故立申陽為河南王，都雒陽。

translations.text: He camped at Gaixia, and the Han King Liu Bang attacked him.

sentences.zh: 韓王成因故都，都陽翟。

translations.text: Xiang Yu said: 'Our army has fought for three years, killed generals, crossed passes, taken cities, but the enemy is many and we are few.'

sentences.zh: 趙將司馬卬定河內，數有功，故立卬為殷王，王河內，都朝歌。

translations.text: He sent Long Ju to ask Han Xin to attack Qi.

sentences.zh: 徙趙王歇為代王。

translations.text: Han Xin said: 'The overlord is in danger, I cannot abandon him.'

sentences.zh: 趙相張耳素賢，又從入關，故立耳為常山王，王趙地，都襄國。

translations.text: Xiang Yu then sent Wu She to persuade Han Xin.

sentences.zh: 當陽君黥布為楚將，常冠軍，故立布為九江王，都六。

translations.text: Wu She said: 'You and the overlord both Chu people, but you became king of Qi.

sentences.zh: 鄱君吳芮率百越佐諸侯，又從入關，故立芮為衡山王，都邾。

translations.text: Now the overlord is in danger, but you do not help, this is disloyal.'

sentences.zh: 義帝柱國共敖將兵擊南郡，功多，因立敖為臨江王，都江陵。

translations.text: Han Xin said: 'The overlord once made me king, I am grateful.

sentences.zh: 徙燕王韓廣為遼東王。

translations.text: But I have heard that if the mother is kind, the son is filial; if the lord is enlightened, the minister is loyal.

sentences.zh: 燕將臧荼從楚救趙，因從入關，故立荼為燕王，都薊。

translations.text: Now the overlord treats me with suspicion and sends someone else, this shows he does not trust me.'

sentences.zh: 徙齊王田市為膠東王。

translations.text: Wu She returned and told Xiang Yu.

sentences.zh: 齊將田都從共救趙，因從入關，故立都為齊王，都臨菑。

translations.text: Xiang Yu sent Ji Xin to attack Qi.

sentences.zh: 故秦所滅齊王建孫田安，項羽方渡河救趙，田安下濟北數城，引其兵降項羽，故立安為濟北王，都博陽。

translations.text: Ji Xin attacked Qi, Han Xin defended Qi.

sentences.zh: 田榮者，數負項梁，又不肯將兵從楚擊秦，以故不封。

translations.text: Han Xin said: 'Ji Xin is brave but not strategic, I can defeat him.'

sentences.zh: 成安君陳餘棄將印去，不從入關，然素聞其賢，有功於趙，聞其在南皮，故因環封三縣。

translations.text: Han Xin lured Ji Xin into a trap, captured him.

sentences.zh: 番君將梅鋗功多，故封十萬戶侯。

translations.text: Han Xin then attacked Chu, defeated Xiang Yu at Gaixia.

sentences.zh: 項王自立為西楚霸王，王九郡，都彭城。

translations.text: Xiang Yu retreated to Dongcheng.

When they reached the Yin Mountains, Xiang Yu ordered the princes' armies to cut paths through the mountains. The princes' armies cut paths, Xiang Yu feared they would take advantage, secretly ordered the strong Chu army to follow behind and kill them. When the princes' armies entered the passes, Xiang Yu sealed the passes, did not let them enter. He stationed troops to guard the passes, then led the Chu army west alone. When Xiang Yu reached Hangu Pass, the Qin forces were still many. Xiang Yu attacked, defeated Qin, entered Hangu Pass. King Yi though without merit, should still divide land and make him king.' The generals all said: 'Good.' Then divided the world, established the generals as marquises and kings. Xiang Yu and Fan Zeng suspected Liu Bang of having ambitions for the world, but having already made peace, and fearing to break the agreement and cause the lords to rebel, secretly plotted saying: 'The roads to Ba and Shu are dangerous, Qin's exiled people all live in Shu.' Then said: 'Ba and Shu are also Guanzhong territory.' Therefore established Liu Bang as Han King, ruling Ba, Shu, Hanzhong, with capital at Nanzheng. And divided Guanzhong into three, made Qin surrendering generals kings to block Han King. Xiang Yu then established Zhang Han as Yong King, ruling west of Xianyang, with capital at Feiqiu. Chief Scribe Xin was formerly Queyang prison clerk, once had kindness to Xiang Liang; Colonel Dong Yi originally advised Zhang Han to surrender to Chu. Therefore established Sima Xin as Sai King, ruling east of Xianyang to the Yellow River, with capital at Queyang; Established Dong Yi as Di King, ruling Shangjun, with capital at Gao. When the division was completed, Xiang Yu wished to march east. He camped at Gaixia, and the Han King Liu Bang attacked him. Xiang Yu said: 'Our army has fought for three years, killed generals, crossed passes, taken cities, but the enemy is many and we are few.' He sent Long Ju to ask Han Xin to attack Qi. Han Xin said: 'The overlord is in danger, I cannot abandon him.' Xiang Yu then sent Wu She to persuade Han Xin. Wu She said: 'You and the overlord both Chu people, but you became king of Qi. Now the overlord is in danger, but you do not help, this is disloyal.' Han Xin said: 'The overlord once made me king, I am grateful. But I have heard that if the mother is kind, the son is filial; if the lord is enlightened, the minister is loyal. Now the overlord treats me with suspicion and sends someone else, this shows he does not trust me.' Wu She returned and told Xiang Yu. Xiang Yu sent Ji Xin to attack Qi. Ji Xin attacked Qi, Han Xin defended Qi. Han Xin said: 'Ji Xin is brave but not strategic, I can defeat him.' Han Xin lured Ji Xin into a trap, captured him. Han Xin then attacked Chu, defeated Xiang Yu at Gaixia. Xiang Yu retreated to Dongcheng.

sentences.zh: 漢之元年四月，諸侯罷戲下，各就國。

translations.text: The Chu army was few, Xiang Yu said: 'I have fought seventy battles, all victorious, captured generals, taken cities, but finally trapped here.'

sentences.zh: 項王出之國，使人徙義帝，曰：「古之帝者地方千里，必居上游。」

translations.text: He divided his army into four, each with orders to break through separately and rendezvous at Dongcheng.

sentences.zh: 乃使使徙義帝長沙郴縣。

translations.text: Xiang Yu said to the generals: 'I will take the enemy.'

sentences.zh: 趣義帝行，其群臣稍稍背叛之，乃陰令衡山、臨江王擊殺之江中。

translations.text: He rode alone, broke through the encirclement, the generals could not follow.

sentences.zh: 韓王成無軍功，項王不使之國，與俱至彭城，廢以為侯，已又殺之。

translations.text: Xiang Yu reached the Wujiang River, his horse was tired, could not cross.

sentences.zh: 臧荼之國，因逐韓廣之遼東，廣弗聽，荼擊殺廣無終，

translations.text: Xiang Yu said: 'Heaven wishes to destroy me, not my fault.'

The Chu army was few, Xiang Yu said: 'I have fought seventy battles, all victorious, captured generals, taken cities, but finally trapped here.' He divided his army into four, each with orders to break through separately and rendezvous at Dongcheng. Xiang Yu said to the generals: 'I will take the enemy.' He rode alone, broke through the encirclement, the generals could not follow. Xiang Yu reached the Wujiang River, his horse was tired, could not cross. Xiang Yu said: 'Heaven wishes to destroy me, not my fault.'

sentences.zh: 田榮聞項羽徙齊王市膠東，而立齊將田都為齊王，乃大怒，不肯遣齊王之膠東，因以齊反，迎擊田都。

translations.text: He turned and fought, killed several hundred enemies, wounded himself many times.

sentences.zh: 田都走楚。

translations.text: He saw his old subordinate Lü Matong among the enemies.

sentences.zh: 齊王市畏項王，乃亡之膠東就國。

translations.text: Lü Matong was formerly Xiang Yu's subordinate, Xiang Yu once captured his father but did not kill him.

sentences.zh: 田榮怒，追擊殺之即墨。

translations.text: Lü Matong said: 'Today you are finished.'

sentences.zh: 榮因自立為齊王，而西殺擊濟北王田安，并王三齊。

translations.text: Xiang Yu laughed and said: 'I heard Han bought your head for a thousand gold and ten thousand households.'

sentences.zh: 榮與彭越將軍印，令反梁地。

translations.text: He drew his sword and committed suicide.

sentences.zh: 陳餘陰使張同、夏說說齊王田榮曰：「項羽為天下宰，不平。

translations.text: The kings of Western Chu all surrendered to Han.

sentences.zh: 今盡王故王於醜地，而王其群臣諸將善地，逐其故主趙王，乃北居代，餘以為不可。

translations.text: Liu Bang became emperor, established the Han dynasty.

sentences.zh: 聞大王起兵，且不聽不義，願大王資餘兵，請以擊常山，以復趙王，請以國為捍蔽。」

translations.text: Han Gao Zu first year, attacked Ying Bu at Jing Province.

sentences.zh: 齊王許之，因遣兵之趙。

translations.text: Second year, attacked Chen Xi at Liang.

sentences.zh: 陳餘悉發三縣兵，與齊并力擊常山，大破之。

translations.text: Third year, attacked Zang Tu at Yan.

sentences.zh: 張耳走歸漢。

translations.text: Fourth year, attacked Wei Bao at Wei.

sentences.zh: 陳餘迎故趙王歇於代，反之趙。

translations.text: Fifth year, attacked Tian Rong at Qi.

sentences.zh: 趙王因立陳餘為代王。

translations.text: Sixth year, attacked Lu Wan at Yan.

He turned and fought, killed several hundred enemies, wounded himself many times. He saw his old subordinate Lü Matong among the enemies. Lü Matong was formerly Xiang Yu's subordinate, Xiang Yu once captured his father but did not kill him. Lü Matong said: 'Today you are finished.' Xiang Yu laughed and said: 'I heard Han bought your head for a thousand gold and ten thousand households.' He drew his sword and committed suicide. The kings of Western Chu all surrendered to Han. Liu Bang became emperor, established the Han dynasty. Han Gao Zu first year, attacked Ying Bu at Jing Province. Second year, attacked Chen Xi at Liang. Third year, attacked Zang Tu at Yan. Fourth year, attacked Wei Bao at Wei. Fifth year, attacked Tian Rong at Qi. Sixth year, attacked Lu Wan at Yan.

sentences.zh: 是時，漢還定三秦。

translations.text: Seventh year, pacified the world.

sentences.zh: 項羽聞漢王皆已并關中，且東，齊、趙叛之：大怒。

translations.text: Han Gao Zu died, Empress Lü acted as regent.

sentences.zh: 乃以故吳令鄭昌為韓王，以距漢。

translations.text: Wen Di ascended, practiced benevolent government.

sentences.zh: 令蕭公角等擊彭越。

translations.text: Jing Di ascended, continued the policies.

sentences.zh: 彭越敗蕭公角等。

translations.text: Wu Di ascended, expanded the empire.

sentences.zh: 漢使張良徇韓，乃遺項王書曰：「漢王失職，欲得關中，如約即止，不敢東。」

translations.text: Wu Di died, Zhao Di ascended.

sentences.zh: 又以齊、梁反書遺項王曰：「齊欲與趙并滅楚。」

translations.text: Zhao Di died, Xuan Di ascended.

sentences.zh: 楚以此故無西意，而北擊齊。

translations.text: Xuan Di died, Yuan Di ascended.

sentences.zh: 徵兵九江王布。

translations.text: Yuan Di died, Cheng Di ascended.

sentences.zh: 布稱疾不往，使將將數千人行。

translations.text: Cheng Di died, Ai Di ascended.

sentences.zh: 項王由此怨布也。

translations.text: Xiang Yu from this resented Bu.

sentences.zh: 漢之二年冬，項羽遂北至城陽，田榮亦將兵會戰。

translations.text: Han second year winter, Xiang Yu then went north to Chengyang, Tian Rong also led troops to battle together.

sentences.zh: 田榮不勝，走至平原，平原民殺之。

translations.text: Tian Rong could not win, fled to Pingyuan, Pingyuan people killed him.

sentences.zh: 遂北燒夷齊城郭室屋，皆阬田榮降卒，系虜其老弱婦女。

translations.text: Then went north burning and destroying Qi city walls houses, all buried Tian Rong's surrendering soldiers, captured and enslaved their old and weak women.

sentences.zh: 徇齊至北海，多所殘滅。

translations.text: Marched through Qi to Beihai, destroyed much.

sentences.zh: 齊人相聚而叛之。

translations.text: Qi people gathered and rebelled against him.

sentences.zh: 於是田榮弟田橫收齊亡卒得數萬人，反城陽。

translations.text: Therefore Tian Rong's younger brother Tian Heng gathered Qi fleeing soldiers got tens of thousands, rebelled at Chengyang.

sentences.zh: 項王因留，連戰未能下。

translations.text: Xiang Yu stayed, fought continuously but could not take it.

Seventh year, pacified the world. Han Gao Zu died, Empress Lü acted as regent. Wen Di ascended, practiced benevolent government. Jing Di ascended, continued the policies. Wu Di ascended, expanded the empire. Wu Di died, Zhao Di ascended. Zhao Di died, Xuan Di ascended. Xuan Di died, Yuan Di ascended. Yuan Di died, Cheng Di ascended. Cheng Di died, Ai Di ascended. Xiang Yu from this resented Bu. Han second year winter, Xiang Yu then went north to Chengyang, Tian Rong also led troops to battle together. Tian Rong could not win, fled to Pingyuan, Pingyuan people killed him. Then went north burning and destroying Qi city walls houses, all buried Tian Rong's surrendering soldiers, captured and enslaved their old and weak women. Marched through Qi to Beihai, destroyed much. Qi people gathered and rebelled against him. Therefore Tian Rong's younger brother Tian Heng gathered Qi fleeing soldiers got tens of thousands, rebelled at Chengyang. Xiang Yu stayed, fought continuously but could not take it.

sentences.zh: 春，漢王部五諸侯兵，凡五十六萬人，東伐楚。

translations.text: Spring, Han King led five lords' troops, total fifty-six thousand men, attacked Chu east.

sentences.zh: 項王聞之，即令諸將擊齊，而自以精兵三萬人南從魯出胡陵。

translations.text: Xiang Yu heard this, immediately ordered the generals to attack Qi, while he personally with elite troops thirty thousand went south from Lu through Huling.

sentences.zh: 四月，漢皆已入彭城，收其貨寶美人，日置酒高會。

translations.text: Fourth month, Han had all entered Pengcheng, collected its goods treasures and beauties, daily held wine feasts.

sentences.zh: 項王乃西從蕭，晨擊漢軍而東，至彭城，日中，大破漢軍。

translations.text: Xiang Yu attacked Han army at Lingbi, greatly defeated them, killed many.

sentences.zh: 漢軍皆走，相隨入穀、泗水，殺漢卒十餘萬人。

translations.text: The Han army fled, Xiang Yu pursued to Yinque, the Han army surrendered.

sentences.zh: 漢卒皆南走山，楚又追擊至靈壁東睢水上。

translations.text: Xiang Yu divided the surrendering Han army into two, ordered the Chu army to cross the Si River, buried alive the surrendering soldiers.

sentences.zh: 漢軍卻，為楚所擠，多殺，漢卒十餘萬人皆入睢水，睢水為之不流。

translations.text: Xiang Yu then camped at Gaixia, the Han army fled south to the Yangtze.

sentences.zh: 圍漢王三匝。

translations.text: Xiang Yu heard Liu Bang had fled to Han, sent Bu Gong to pursue and attack Liu Bang.

sentences.zh: 於是大風從西北而起，折木發屋，揚沙石，窈冥晝晦，逢迎楚軍。

translations.text: Liu Bang sent Lu Wan to defend Yan, attacked Wei Bao at Wei.

sentences.zh: 楚軍大亂，壞散，而漢王乃得與數十騎遁去，欲過沛，收家室而西；

translations.text: Attacked Chen Xi at Dai.

sentences.zh: 楚亦使人追之沛，取漢王家：家皆亡，不與漢王相見。

translations.text: Attacked Zang Tu at Yan.

sentences.zh: 漢王道逢得孝惠、魯元，乃載行。

translations.text: Attacked Tian Rong at Qi.

sentences.zh: 楚騎追漢王，漢王急，推墮孝惠、魯元車下，滕公常下收載之。

translations.text: Attacked Han Xin at Chu.

sentences.zh: 如是者三。

translations.text: Attacked Ying Bu at Jiujiang.

sentences.zh: 曰：「雖急不可以驅，柰何棄之？」

translations.text: Attacked Wu Rui at Hengshan.

sentences.zh: 於是遂得脫。

translations.text: Attacked Gong Ao at Linhuai.

sentences.zh: 求太公、呂后不相遇。

translations.text: Attacked Zhang Er at Zhao.

sentences.zh: 審食其從太公、呂后閒行，求漢王，反遇楚軍。

translations.text: Attacked Wei Bao at Wei.

sentences.zh: 楚軍遂與歸，報項王，項王常置軍中。

translations.text: Attacked Sima Ang at Dai.

Spring, Han King led five lords' troops, total fifty-six thousand men, attacked Chu east. Xiang Yu heard this, immediately ordered the generals to attack Qi, while he personally with elite troops thirty thousand went south from Lu through Huling. Fourth month, Han had all entered Pengcheng, collected its goods treasures and beauties, daily held wine feasts. Xiang Yu attacked Han army at Lingbi, greatly defeated them, killed many. The Han army fled, Xiang Yu pursued to Yinque, the Han army surrendered. Xiang Yu divided the surrendering Han army into two, ordered the Chu army to cross the Si River, buried alive the surrendering soldiers. Xiang Yu then camped at Gaixia, the Han army fled south to the Yangtze. Xiang Yu heard Liu Bang had fled to Han, sent Bu Gong to pursue and attack Liu Bang. Liu Bang sent Lu Wan to defend Yan, attacked Wei Bao at Wei. Attacked Chen Xi at Dai. Attacked Zang Tu at Yan. Attacked Tian Rong at Qi. Attacked Han Xin at Chu. Attacked Ying Bu at Jiujiang. sentences.zh: 是時呂后兄周呂侯為漢將兵居下邑，漢王閒往從之，稍稍收其士卒。

translations.text: Attacked Zhang Er at Changshan.

sentences.zh: 至滎陽，諸敗軍皆會，蕭何亦發關中老弱未傅悉詣滎陽，復大振。

translations.text: Xiang Yu returned to Chu, attacked Liu Bang at Guling.

sentences.zh: 楚起於彭城，常乘勝逐北，與漢戰滎陽南京、索閒，漢敗楚，楚以故不能過滎陽而西。

translations.text: Liu Bang fled to Pingcheng, Xiang Yu pursued to Henei.
Attacked Zhang Er at Changshan. Xiang Yu returned to Chu, attacked Liu Bang at Guling. Liu Bang fled to Pingcheng, Xiang Yu pursued to Henei.

sentences.zh: 項王之救彭城，追漢王至滎陽，田橫亦得收齊，立田榮子廣為齊王。

translations.text: Liu Bang sent Zhang Liang to negotiate peace with Xiang Yu.

sentences.zh: 漢王之敗彭城，諸侯皆復與楚而背漢。

translations.text: Xiang Yu agreed to divide the world at Hong Canal, east for Chu, west for Han.

sentences.zh: 漢軍滎陽，筑甬道屬之河，以取敖倉粟。

translations.text: Xiang Yu released Liu Bang's father and wife.

sentences.zh: 漢之三年，項王數侵奪漢甬道，漢王食乏，恐，請和，割滎陽以西為漢。

translations.text: Xiang Yu camped at Guangwu, Liu Bang camped at Chenggao.

sentences.zh: 歷陽侯范增曰：「漢易與耳，今釋弗取，後必悔之。」

translations.text: Xiang Yu pursued to Yongqiu, Liu Bang fled to Chenliu.

sentences.zh: 項王使者來，為太牢具，舉欲進之。

translations.text: Xiang Yu pursued to solid earth, Liu Bang fled to Henei.

sentences.zh: 見使者，詳驚愕曰：「吾以為亞父使者，乃反項王使者。」

sentences.zh: 更持去，以惡食食項王使者。

translations.text: Liu Bang sent Guo Ji to negotiate peace, Xiang Yu agreed.

sentences.zh: 使者歸報項王，項王乃疑范增與漢有私，稍奪之權。

translations.text: Xiang Yu camped at Guangwu, Liu Bang camped at Xiaohe.

sentences.zh: 范增大怒，曰：「天下事大定矣，君王自為之。

translations.text: Xiang Yu attacked Han Xin at Qi, Han Xin fled.

sentences.zh: 願賜骸骨歸卒伍。」

translations.text: Xiang Yu attacked Peng Yue at Liang, Peng Yue fled.

translations.text: Chu then took Chenggao, wished to go west.

translations.text: Han sent troops to resist at Gong, prevented them from going west.
